# How to Fix the Error "Failed to setup driver 536870325" on Windows 10
 
If you are trying to install or update a device driver on your Windows 10 computer and you encounter the error message "Failed to setup driver 536870325", you are not alone. This error is caused by a corrupted or incompatible driver that prevents Windows from recognizing your device properly. Fortunately, there are some easy solutions that you can try to fix this error and get your device working again.
 
## Failed to setup driver 536870325


[**Download**](https://www.google.com/url?q=https%3A%2F%2Fssurll.com%2F2tKFgW&sa=D&sntz=1&usg=AOvVaw1VFJTQPLhmbI_vvOOFaz-b)

 
## What Causes the Error "Failed to setup driver 536870325"?
 
The error "Failed to setup driver 536870325" usually occurs when Windows tries to install or update a device driver that is either corrupted, outdated, or incompatible with your system. This can happen due to various reasons, such as:
 
- A faulty or incomplete download of the driver from the manufacturer's website or a third-party source.
- A malware infection or a system crash that damages the driver files or registry entries.
- A hardware conflict or a compatibility issue between the device and your computer.
- A missing or outdated Windows update that affects the driver functionality.

Depending on the cause of the error, you may also experience other symptoms, such as:

- Your device not working properly or not showing up in Device Manager.
- Your computer freezing, crashing, or showing a blue screen of death (BSOD).
- Your computer running slowly or having performance issues.

## How to Fix the Error "Failed to setup driver 536870325"?
 
To fix the error "Failed to setup driver 536870325", you need to uninstall the problematic driver and install a new one that is compatible with your device and Windows 10. Here are the steps you need to follow:

1. Press <kbd>Windows</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> keys on your keyboard to open the Run dialog box.
2. Type `devmgmt.msc` and click OK to open Device Manager.
3. Find the device that is causing the error and right-click on it. Select Uninstall device from the context menu.
4. Check the box that says Delete the driver software for this device and click Uninstall.
5. Restart your computer and wait for Windows to automatically detect and install the device driver. If Windows does not install the driver automatically, you can go to the manufacturer's website and download the latest driver for your device. Make sure you choose the correct driver for your device model and Windows 10 version.
6. Follow the on-screen instructions to install the driver and restart your computer if prompted.

This should fix the error "Failed to setup driver 536870325" and make your device work properly. However, if you still encounter the error after following these steps, you may need to try some other solutions, such as:

- Running a malware scan and removing any viruses or malware that may have infected your system.
- Updating your Windows 10 to the latest version and installing any pending updates.
- Performing a system restore or a clean install of Windows 10 if none of the above solutions work.

## Conclusion
 
The error "Failed to setup driver 536870325" is a common issue that many Windows 10 users face when trying to install or update a device driver. It can be caused by various factors, such as a corrupted or incompatible driver, a malware infection, a hardware conflict, or a missing Windows update. To fix this error, you need to uninstall the problematic driver and install a new one that is compatible with your device and Windows 10. You can also try some other solutions, such as running a malware scan, updating your Windows 10, or performing a system restore or a clean install of Windows 10 if necessary. We hope this article has helped you resolve this error and make your device work smoothly again.
